00071 uvm_ml_packed_obj::uvm_ml_packed_obj() :
00072   size(0), val(0), max_words(0) {
00073 }
00074 
00075 uvm_ml_packed_obj::~uvm_ml_packed_obj() {
00076   if (val) {
00077     delete[] val;
00078   }
00079 }
00080 
00081 void uvm_ml_packed_obj::allocate(uvm_ml_packed_obj* v, unsigned nwords) {
00082   if (v->max_words >= nwords)
00083     return;
00084   // need to allocate new m/m
00085   v->max_words = nwords;
00086   if (v->val) {
00087     delete[] v->val;
00088   }
00089   v->val = new unsigned[v->max_words];
00090 }

00395 static bp_frmw_c_api_struct* uvm_ml_sc_get_required_api()
00396 {
00397     bp_frmw_c_api_struct * required_api = new bp_frmw_c_api_struct();
00398     memset(required_api, '\0', sizeof(bp_frmw_c_api_struct));
00399     required_api->set_trace_mode_ptr= uvm_ml_tlm_rec::set_debug_mode;
00400     required_api->startup_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::startup;
00401     required_api->construct_top_ptr=uvm_ml_tlm_rec::construct_top;
00402 
00403     // ----- Phasing APIs
00404     required_api->transmit_phase_ptr = uvm_ml_phase::transmit_phase;
00405     required_api->notify_phase_ptr = uvm_ml_phase::notify_phase;
00406     required_api->notify_runtime_phase_ptr = uvm_ml_phase::notify_runtime_phase;
00407 
00408     required_api->find_connector_id_by_name_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::find_connector_id_by_name;
00409     required_api->get_connector_intf_name_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_connector_intf_name;
00410     required_api->is_export_connector_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::is_export_connector;
00411     required_api->try_put_uvm_ml_stream_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::nb_put;
00412     required_api->can_put_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::can_put;
00413     required_api->put_uvm_ml_stream_request_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::request_put;
00414     required_api->get_uvm_ml_stream_request_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::request_get;
00415     required_api->get_requested_uvm_ml_stream_ptr = uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_requested;

00471 
00472 void report_tlm1_error(uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec) {
00473   char msg[1024];
00474   if (rec) {
00475     sprintf(msg, "\nSystemC export name is '%s'\n"
00476             "TLM1 interface is '%s'\n"
00477             "uvm_object payload type is '%s'\n", 
00478             rec->object()->name(), 
00479             rec->get_intf_name().c_str(), 
00480             rec->get_REQ_name().c_str()
00481            );
00482     SC_REPORT_WARNING(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_, msg);
00483   } else {
00484     SC_REPORT_WARNING(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_, "\n");
00485   }
00486   CURRENT_SIMCONTEXT_SET_ERROR();
00487 }
00488 
00489 void report_connector_error(ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn) {
00490   char msg[1024];
00491   if (conn) {
00492     sprintf(msg, "\nTLM2 connector\n");
00493     SC_REPORT_WARNING(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_, msg);
00494   } else {
00495     SC_REPORT_WARNING(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_, "\n");
00496   }
00497   CURRENT_SIMCONTEXT_SET_ERROR();
00498 }

00508 uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info::uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info(const string & name, unsigned id) {
00509   m_name = name;
00510   m_id = id;
00511   m_nextid = 0;
00512   m_object = sc_find_object(name.c_str());
00513   if (!m_object) {
00514     char msg[1024];
00515     sprintf(msg, "\nPort/export is '%s' \n", name.c_str());
00516     SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_OBJ_NOT_FOUND_, msg);
00517     return;
00518   }
00519 }

00521 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::m_nextid = 1;

00537 bool uvm_ml_utils::m_trace_register_on = false;
00538 
00539 void uvm_ml_utils::add_tlm2_connector(const string & s, ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn) {
00540   pair<map<string,unsigned>::iterator,bool> ret_soc; 
00541   pair<map<unsigned, ml_tlm2_connector_base*>::iterator,bool> ret_conn; 
00542 
00543   if (!socket_map) {
00544     socket_map = new map<string, unsigned>();
00545   }
00546   conn->conn_id = m_nextid++;
00547   ret_soc = socket_map->insert(pair<string,unsigned>(s,conn->conn_id));
00548   if (!connector_map) {
00549     connector_map = new map<unsigned, ml_tlm2_connector_base*>();
00550   }
00551   ret_conn = connector_map->insert(pair<unsigned,ml_tlm2_connector_base*>(conn->conn_id,conn));
00552   register_static_top(s);
00553 }
00554 
00555 ml_tlm2_connector_base* uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(unsigned target_connector_id)
00556   {
00557     map<unsigned, ml_tlm2_connector_base*>::iterator it;
00558 
00559     it = connector_map->find(target_connector_id);
00560     if (it == connector_map->end()) return 0;
00561     return connector_map->find(target_connector_id)->second;
00562   }
00563 
00564 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::find_socket_id(const string & s) {
00565   if (socket_map == NULL) return 0;
00566 
00567   map<string,unsigned>::iterator it;
00568   it = socket_map->find(s);
00569   if (it == socket_map->end()) return 0;
00570   return socket_map->find(s)->second;
00571 }
00572 
00573 bool uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(unsigned connector_id) {
00574   if (uvm_ml_utils::connector_map == NULL) return false;
00575 
00576   map<unsigned, ml_tlm2_connector_base*>::iterator it;
00577 
00578   it = uvm_ml_utils::connector_map->find(connector_id);
00579   if (it == uvm_ml_utils::connector_map->end()) 
00580     return false;
00581   else
00582     return true;
00583 }
00584 
00585 void uvm_ml_utils::add_transrec_to_map(
00586   sc_object* obj, 
00587   uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr
00588 ) {
00589   if (!obj_transrec_map) {
00590     obj_transrec_map = new map<sc_object*, uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base*>();
00591   }
00592   (*obj_transrec_map)[obj] = tr;
00593 }
00594 
00595 uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* uvm_ml_utils::get_transrec(sc_object* obj) {
00596   if (!obj_transrec_map) return 0;
00597   return (*obj_transrec_map)[obj];
00598 }
00599 
00600 uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* uvm_ml_utils::get_or_create_conn_info(const string & name) {
00601   if (!conn_info_by_name) {
00602     conn_info_by_name = new sc_strhash<uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info*>();
00603   }
00604   if (!conn_info_by_id) {
00605     conn_info_by_id = new map<unsigned,uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info*>();
00606   }
00607   uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* info = get_conn_info(name);
00608   if (!info) {
00609     unsigned id = m_nextid++;
00610     info = new uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info(name,id);
00611   }
00612   (*conn_info_by_id)[info->id()] = info;
00613   conn_info_by_name->insert(strdup(name.c_str()),info);
00614   return info;
00615 }
00616 
00617 uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* uvm_ml_utils::get_conn_info(const string & name) {
00618   if (!conn_info_by_name) return 0;
00619   return (*conn_info_by_name)[name.c_str()];
00620 }
00621 
00622 uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* uvm_ml_utils::get_conn_info(unsigned id) {
00623   if (!conn_info_by_id) return 0;
00624   return (*conn_info_by_id)[id];
00625 }

00636 static map<unsigned, sc_time_unit> call_id_delay_unit_dict;
00637 static map<unsigned, double> call_id_delay_value_dict;

00640   return framework_id; 
00641 }

00643 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::uvm_ml_tlm_id_from_name(const string & name) {
00644   uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* info = get_conn_info(name);
00645   if (!info) return unsigned(-1);
00646   return info->id();
00647 }
00648 
00649 bool uvm_ml_utils::is_tree_node_quasi_static(unsigned root_node_id)
00650 {
00651   return root_node_id >= static_top_names.size();
00652 }
00653 
00654 sc_module * uvm_ml_utils::get_quasi_static_tree_node_by_id(unsigned node_id)
00655 {
00656  char msg[1024];
00657   if(!((node_id >= static_top_names.size()) && (node_id < static_top_names.size() + quasi_static_tree_nodes.size()))) {
00658     sprintf(msg,"\nID is %d", node_id);
00659     UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: Subtree node was not found",msg);
00660     return NULL;
00661   };
00662   //assert ((node_id >= static_top_names.size()) && (node_id < static_top_names.size() + quasi_static_tree_nodes.size())); // Otherwise an internal error
00663   return quasi_static_tree_nodes[node_id - static_top_names.size()];
00664 }

00666 // TLM2
00667 static uvm_ml_time_unit m_time_unit = TIME_UNIT_UNDEFINED;
00668 static double           m_time_value = -1;
00669 
00670 unsigned int uvm_ml_tlm_trans::tlm2_nb_transport_bw(
00671       unsigned         connector_id,
00672       MLUPO *          val,
00673       unsigned int *   phase,
00674       unsigned int     transaction_id,
00675       sc_time_unit *   delay_unit,
00676       double *         delay_value
00677 ) {
00678   unsigned int ret;
00679   unsigned *ptr;
00680 
00681   ptr = val->val; // save pointer
00682   ret = (unsigned int) BP(nb_transport_bw)(
00683                                       framework_id,
00684                                       connector_id,
00685                                       &(val->size),
00686                                       &(val->val),
00687                                       (uvm_ml_tlm_phase *)phase,
00688                                       transaction_id,
00689                                       (uvm_ml_time_unit *) delay_unit,
00690                                       delay_value,
00691                                       m_time_unit,
00692                                       m_time_value
00693                                       );
00694   if(val->val != ptr) delete[] ptr; // delete old value if it was reassigned
00695   return ret;
00696 }
00697 
00698 unsigned int uvm_ml_tlm_trans::tlm2_nb_transport_fw(
00699       unsigned         connector_id,
00700       MLUPO *          val,
00701       unsigned int *   phase,
00702       unsigned int     transaction_id,
00703       sc_time_unit *   delay_unit,
00704       double *         delay_value 
00705 ) {
00706   unsigned int ret;
00707   unsigned *ptr;
00708 
00709   ptr = val->val; // save pointer
00710   ret = (unsigned int) BP(nb_transport_fw)(
00711                                       framework_id,
00712                                       connector_id,
00713                                       &(val->size),
00714                                       &(val->val),
00715                                       (uvm_ml_tlm_phase *)phase,
00716                                       transaction_id,
00717                                       (uvm_ml_time_unit *) delay_unit,
00718                                       delay_value, 
00719                                       m_time_unit,
00720                                       m_time_value
00721                                       );
00722   if(val->val != ptr) delete[] ptr; // delete old value if it was reassigned
00723   return ret;
00724 }
00725 
00726 unsigned uvm_ml_tlm_trans::tlm2_transport_dbg(
00727       unsigned              connector_id,
00728       MLUPO *               val 
00729 ) {
00730   unsigned int ret;
00731   unsigned *ptr;
00732 
00733   ptr = val->val; // save pointer
00734   ret = BP(transport_dbg)(
00735                                       framework_id,
00736                                       connector_id,
00737                                       &(val->size),
00738                                       &(val->val),
00739                                       m_time_unit,
00740                                       m_time_value
00741                                       );
00742   if(val->val != ptr) delete[] ptr; // delete old value if it was reassigned
00743   return ret;
00744 }
00745 
00746 void uvm_ml_tlm_trans::tlm2_b_transport(
00747       unsigned         connector_id,
00748       MLUPO *          val,
00749       sc_time_unit *   delay_unit,
00750       double *         delay_value
00751 ) {
00752   unsigned *ptr;
00753   unsigned call_id = fake_blocking_call_id++;
00754   unsigned done = 0;
00755 
00756   ptr = val->val; // save pointer
00757   int disable = BP(request_b_transport_tlm2)(
00758                                       framework_id,
00759                                       connector_id,
00760                                       call_id,
00761                                       &(val->size),
00762                                       &(val->val),
00763                                       (uvm_ml_time_unit)*delay_unit,
00764                                       *delay_value,
00765                                       &done,
00766                                       m_time_unit,
00767                                       m_time_value
00768                                       );
00769   if(val->val != ptr) delete[] ptr; // delete old value if it was reassigned
00770 
00771   if (!done) {
00772     // new sc_event; hash <call_id , event>; wait on event;
00773     // later target will cause event to be triggered
00774     void* p_call_id;
00775     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
00776     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
00777     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
00778     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
00779     p_call_id = (void *)(unsigned long)call_id;
00780 
00781     sc_event* e = new INVISIBLE_EVENT("uvm_fake_blocking");
00782 
00783     call_id_trans_dict.insert(p_call_id, e);
00784     sc_core::wait(*e);
00785     // we are here when the target framework has informed us via 
00786     // the backplane that the call has finished in it;
00787     // get the return value of get() from the backplane
00788     ptr = val->val; // save pointer
00789 
00790     int ret = BP(b_transport_tlm2_response)(framework_id,
00791                                             connector_id,
00792                                             call_id,
00793                                             &(val->size),
00794                                             val->val);
00795     if (ret != 0) ret = 0; // TBD: issue an error message
00796 
00797     if(val->val != ptr) delete[] ptr; // delete old value if it was reassigned
00798     delete e;
00799   }
00800 
00801   if (disable == 1) {
00802 
00803       uvm_ml::dpi_task_disabled();
00804   }
00805 }
00806 
00807 
00808 
00809 // Return -1 for failure
00810 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::construct_top(const char* top_identifier, const char * instance_name) {
00811 #ifndef UVM_ML_PORTABLE
00812  char msg[1024];
00813  try {
00814      sc_module * m = NULL;
00815      // first see if object can be created by uvm factory
00816      if (uvm_factory::is_component_registered(string(top_identifier))) {
00817        m = uvm_factory::create_component(string(top_identifier), "", 
00818                                          string(instance_name));
00819        // assuming nothing can go wrong in creation
00820        //assert(m);
00821        if(m == NULL) {
00822          sprintf(msg,"\ntop identifier is %s; instance name is %s\n", top_identifier, instance_name);
00823          UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: top component could not be created",msg);
00824          return -1;
00825        };
00826      } else {
00827        // not uvm_component registered with factory
00828        // see if it is sc_module
00829        m = QUASI_STATIC_CONSTRUCT_TOP(string(top_identifier), string(instance_name));
00830 
00831        if (!m) {
00832          // not module, now print error that not registered with factory
00833          char msg[1024];
00834          sprintf(msg, "\nSystemC object name is '%s'", top_identifier); 
00835          cerr << "before throwing error"<< endl;
00836          SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_MISSING_REGISTRATION_, msg);
00837          return -1;
00838        }
00839     }
00840     return uvm_ml_utils::add_quasi_static_tree_node(m);
00841   }
00842   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
00843 #else
00844  sc_object * inst = sc_core::sc_find_object(instance_name);
00845  if (inst != 0) {
00846      sc_module * node = DCAST<sc_module *>(inst);
00847      if (node)
00848          return uvm_ml_utils::add_quasi_static_tree_node(node);
00849  } else {
00850      char msg[1024];
00851      sprintf(msg,"\nUVM-SC adapter: construct_top() failed, instance name %s was not found", instance_name);
00852      cout << msg << endl;
00853      return -1;
00854  }
00855 #endif
00856 }

00859 }

00863 
00864 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::find_connector_id_by_name(const char * path) { 
00865   try {
00866     unsigned conn_id = uvm_ml_utils::find_socket_id(path);
00867     if (conn_id != 0) {
00868       return conn_id;
00869     }
00870 #ifdef MTI_SYSTEMC
00871     sc_object* obj = sc_find_object(path, sc_get_curr_simcontext());
00872 #else
00873     sc_object* obj = sc_find_object(path);
00874 #endif
00875     if (!obj) {
00876 
00877       char msg[1024];
00878       sprintf(msg, "\nPort/export is '%s' \n", path);
00879       SC_REPORT_INFO(ML_UVM_OBJ_NOT_FOUND_, msg);
00880       return (-1);
00881     }
00882     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = uvm_ml_utils::get_transrec(obj);
00883     if (!tr) {
00884       char msg[1024];
00885       sprintf(msg, "\nPort/export is '%s' \n", path);
00886       SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_NO_TRANS_REC_, msg);
00887       return (-1);
00888     }
00889     tr->id_is_valid(true);
00890     uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* info =
00891       uvm_ml_utils::get_or_create_conn_info(path);
00892     return info->id();
00893   }
00894   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
00895 }
00896 
00897 static const char * map_intf_name(const string & s) {
00898   const char * c_s = s.c_str();
00899   try {
00900     if (s=="tlm_blocking_put_if") return "tlm_blocking_put";
00901     if (s=="tlm_nonblocking_put_if") return "tlm_nonblocking_put";
00902     if (s=="tlm_put_if") return "tlm_put";
00903   
00904     if (s=="tlm_blocking_get_if") return "tlm_blocking_get";
00905     if (s=="tlm_nonblocking_get_if") return "tlm_nonblocking_get";
00906     if (s=="tlm_get_if") return "tlm_get";
00907 
00908     if (s=="tlm_blocking_peek_if") return "tlm_blocking_peek";
00909     if (s=="tlm_nonblocking_peek_if") return "tlm_nonblocking_peek";
00910     if (s=="tlm_peek_if") return "tlm_peek";
00911 
00912     if (s=="tlm_blocking_get_peek_if") return "tlm_blocking_get_peek";
00913     if (s=="tlm_nonblocking_get_peek_if") return "tlm_nonblocking_get_peek";
00914     if (s=="tlm_get_peek_if") return "tlm_get_peek";
00915 
00916     if (s=="tlm_master_if") return "tlm_master";
00917     if (s=="tlm_slave_if") return "tlm_slave";
00918 
00919     if (s=="tlm_transport_if") return "tlm_blocking_transport";
00920     if (s=="tlm_analysis_if") return "tlm_analysis";
00921     return c_s;
00922   }
00923   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, c_s, 0, 0)
00924 }
00925 
00926 const char* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_connector_intf_name(
00927   unsigned connector_id
00928 ) { 
00929   try {
00930     if(uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(connector_id))
00931       return map_intf_name(uvm_ml_utils::connector_map->find(connector_id)->second->get_intf_name());
00932     else {
00933       uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = get_transrec_base(connector_id);
00934       if (!tr)
00935         return (char*)("ERROR");
00936 
00937       return map_intf_name(tr->get_intf_name());
00938     }
00939   }
00940   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
00941 }
00942 
00943 char* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_connector_REQ_name(
00944   unsigned connector_id
00945 ) { 
00946   try {
00947     static string sm;
00948     if(uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(connector_id)) {
00949       char* c = (char*)(sm.c_str());
00950       return c;
00951     }
00952     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = get_transrec_base(connector_id);
00953     if (!tr) {
00954       char* e = (char*)("ERROR");
00955       return e;
00956     }
00957     sm = tr->get_REQ_name();
00958     char* c = (char*)(sm.c_str());
00959     return c;
00960   }
00961   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
00962 }
00963 
00964 char* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_connector_RSP_name(
00965   unsigned connector_id
00966 ) { 
00967   try {
00968     static string sm;
00969     if(uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(connector_id)) {
00970       char* c = (char*)(sm.c_str());
00971       return c;

00976       return e;

00983 }
00984 
00985 unsigned uvm_ml_tlm_rec::is_export_connector(
00986   unsigned connector_id
00987 ) { 
00988   try {
00989     if(uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(connector_id)) {
00990       ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn = uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id);
00991       return conn->is_target;
00992     }
00993     uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* info = 
00994       uvm_ml_utils::get_conn_info(connector_id);
00995     if (!info) {
00996       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_CONNECTOR_ID_NOT_FOUND_,"");
00997       return 0;
00998     }
00999     sc_object* obj = info->object();
01000     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = uvm_ml_utils::get_transrec(obj);
01001     if (!tr) {
01002       char msg[1024];
01003       sprintf(msg, "\nPort/export is '%s' \n", obj->name());
01004       SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_NO_TRANS_REC_, msg);
01005       return 0;
01006     }
01007     if (tr->is_transmitter()) {
01008       return 0;
01009     }
01010     return 1;
01011   }
01012   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
01013 }
01014 
01015 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::set_multiport(char* port_name) {
01016   try {
01017     // multiport, error out
01018     char msg[1024];
01019     sprintf(msg, "\nPort is '%s' \n", port_name);
01020     SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_NO_MULTIPORT_, msg);
01021     return 0;
01022   }
01023   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
01024 }
01025 
01026 uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_transrec_base(
01027   unsigned connector_id
01028 ) {
01029   try {
01030     uvm_ml_tlm_conn_info* info = uvm_ml_utils::get_conn_info(connector_id);
01031     sc_object* obj = info->object();
01032     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = uvm_ml_utils::get_transrec(obj);
01033     if (!tr) {
01034       // should this really be an assert that tr exists? Should not have come 
01035       // this far otherwise
01036       char msg[1024];
01037       sprintf(msg, "\nPort/export is '%s' \n", obj->name());
01038       SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_NO_TRANS_REC_, msg);
01039     }
01040     return tr;
01041   }
01042   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
01043 }
01044 
01045 uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_receiver_base(
01046   unsigned connector_id
01047 ) {
01048   try {
01049     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = get_transrec_base(connector_id);
01050     if (!tr) return 0;
01051     if (tr->is_transmitter()) {
01052       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_RECEIVER_NOT_VALID_,"");
01053       return 0;
01054     }
01055     uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = DCAST<uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base*>(tr);
01056     if (!rec) {
01057       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_RECEIVER_NOT_VALID_,"");
01058       return 0;
01059     }
01060     return rec;
01061   }
01062   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
01063 }
01064 
01065 uvm_ml_tlm_transmitter_base* uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_transmitter_base(
01066   unsigned connector_id
01067 ) {
01068   try {
01069     // never called
01070     uvm_ml_tlm_transrec_base* tr = get_transrec_base(connector_id);
01071     if (!tr) return 0;
01072     if (!(tr->is_transmitter())) {
01073       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_TRANSMITTER_NOT_VALID_,"");
01074       return 0;
01075     }
01076     uvm_ml_tlm_transmitter_base* trans = DCAST<uvm_ml_tlm_transmitter_base*>(tr);
01077     if (!trans) {
01078       SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_TRANSMITTER_NOT_VALID_,"");
01079       return 0;
01080     }
01081     return trans;
01082   }
01083   UVM_ML_CATCH_SC_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_1(UVM_ML_QUASI_STATIC_ELABORATION, 0, 0, 0)
01084 }
01085 
01086 // put takes part in disable protocol as it is blocking,
01087 // so exception catching is more specialized
01088 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::put(
01089     unsigned connector_id, 
01090     unsigned stream_size, 
01091     uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01092   uvm_ml_time_unit * time_unit, 
01093   double           * time_value
01094 ) {
01095     ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01096   int ret = 0;
01097   EXCEPTION_HANDLER_STORAGE();
01098   char msg[1024];
01099   sprintf(msg, "\nTLM function is put");
01100   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01101   try {
01102       STORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01103     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01104     if (!rec) {
01105         RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01106         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01107       return 0;
01108     }
01109     ret = rec->put_bitstream(stream_size, stream);
01110     RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01111     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01112     return ret;
01113   }
01114   //CATCH_EXCEPTION_POP(msg);
01115   SC_KILL_CATCHER()
01116   catch( const sc_report& ex ) {
01117       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01118       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01119       UVM_ML_SC_PRINT_REPORT(ex);
01120     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01121 
01122     return ret;
01123 
01124   }
01125   catch( const ::std::exception& x )
01126   {
01127       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01128       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01129       UVM_ML_REPORT_COMPOSE_MESSAGE(x);
01130       report_tlm1_error(rec);
01131       return ret;
01132   }
01133   catch( const char* s )
01134   {
01135       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01136       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01137     cout << "\n" << s << "\n";
01138     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01139     return ret;
01140   }
01141   EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01142   return ret;
01143 
01144 }
01145 
01146 void put_bitstream_request_helper(
01147   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec,
01148   unsigned call_id,
01149   unsigned callback_adapter_id,
01150   uvm_ml_packed_obj* mlupo_stream
01151 ) {
01152   try {
01153     // call blocking put()
01154     rec->put_bitstream(mlupo_stream->size, mlupo_stream->val);
01155     // when put() returns, callback into source adapter
01156     // to inform that call has ended
01157     uvm_ml_tlm_trans::notify_end_blocking(callback_adapter_id, call_id);
01158     //delete mlupo_stream;
01159     uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(mlupo_stream);
01160   }
01161   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_3
01162 }
01163 
01164 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::request_put(
01165   unsigned connector_id, 
01166   unsigned call_id, 
01167   unsigned callback_adapter_id, 
01168   unsigned stream_size, 
01169   uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01170   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01171   double           time_value
01172 ) { 
01173   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01174   try {
01175       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01176       rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01177       if (!rec) { 
01178           EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01179           return 0; 
01180       }
01181     // this form is called when we're doing fake blocking; so cannot
01182     // call put() directly and block;
01183     // instead, spawn a helper thread that will do the blocking call
01184     // and return
01185     sc_spawn_options op;
01186 
01187     MARK_THREAD_INVISIBLE(op);
01188     char name[1024];
01189     sprintf(name, "put_bitstream_request_helper_%d", call_id);
01190     
01191     // copy the stream into a mlupo. This is necessary because it is 
01192     // likely that in backplane, they use the same stream for 
01193     // multiple calls - so for back to back calls the arguments will get
01194     // overwritten until we make a copy here;
01195     // the helper will delete the mlupo we allocate here when it is done
01196 
01197     //MLUPO* mlupo_stream = new MLUPO;
01198     MLUPO* mlupo_stream = uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool();
01199     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(*mlupo_stream,stream_size,stream);
01200   
01201     sc_core::sc_spawn(sc_bind(&put_bitstream_request_helper,
01202                               rec,
01203                               call_id,
01204                               callback_adapter_id,
01205                               mlupo_stream
01206                              ),
01207                         name, 
01208                         &op
01209                      );
01210     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01211     return 0;
01212   }
01213   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_2_INT
01214   return 0;
01215 }
01216 
01217 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::nb_put(
01218   unsigned connector_id, 
01219   unsigned stream_size , 
01220   uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01221   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01222   double           time_value
01223 ) { 
01224   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01225   try {
01226       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01227       rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01228     if (!rec) { 
01229         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01230       return 0; 
01231     }
01232     int i = rec->try_put_bitstream(stream_size,stream);
01233     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01234     return i;
01235   }
01236   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_1
01237 }
01238 
01239 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::can_put(
01240   unsigned connector_id, 
01241   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01242   double           time_value
01243 ) { 
01244   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;

01247     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01248     if (!rec) { 
01249         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01250       return 0; 
01251     }
01252     int i = rec->can_put();
01253     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01254     return i;
01255   }
01256   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_1
01257 }
01258 
01259 // get_bitstream takes part in disable protocol as it is blocking,
01260 // so exception catching is more specialized
01261 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get(
01262   unsigned connector_id, 
01263   unsigned* stream_size_ptr,
01264   uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01265   uvm_ml_time_unit * time_unit, 
01266   double           * time_value
01267 ) { 
01268     ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01269   int ret = 0;
01270   EXCEPTION_HANDLER_STORAGE();
01271   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01272   try {
01273       STORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01274     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01275     if (!rec) { 
01276         RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01277         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01278       return 0; 
01279     }
01280     ret = rec->get_bitstream(stream_size_ptr, stream);
01281     RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01282     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01283     return ret;
01284   }
01285   SC_KILL_CATCHER()
01286   catch( const sc_report& ex ) {
01287       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01288       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01289       UVM_ML_SC_PRINT_REPORT(ex);
01290     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01291     return ret;
01292   }
01293   catch( const ::std::exception& x )
01294   {
01295       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01296       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01297       UVM_ML_REPORT_COMPOSE_MESSAGE(x);
01298       
01299     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01300     return ret;
01301   }
01302   catch( const char* s )
01303   {
01304       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01305       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01306     cout << "\n" << s << "\n";
01307     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01308     return ret;
01309   }
01310   EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01311   return ret;
01312 
01313 }
01314 
01315 void get_bitstream_request_helper(
01316   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec,
01317   unsigned call_id,
01318   unsigned callback_adapter_id
01319 ) {
01320   try {
01321     // call blocking get()
01322     MLUPO* retval = uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool();
01323     uvm_ml_utils::allocate_mlupo(retval);
01324     rec->get_bitstream(&(retval->size), retval->val);
01325     // when get() returns, first hash return value with call id be 
01326     // retrieved later thru get_requested_bitstream()
01327     void* p_call_id;
01328       // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01329       // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01330       // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01331       // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01332     p_call_id = (void *)(unsigned long)call_id;
01333     call_id_rec_dict.insert(p_call_id, retval);
01334     // callback into source adapter
01335     // to inform that call has ended
01336     uvm_ml_tlm_trans::notify_end_blocking(callback_adapter_id, call_id);
01337   }
01338   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_3
01339 }
01340 
01341 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::request_get(
01342   unsigned connector_id, 
01343   unsigned call_id,
01344   unsigned callback_adapter_id, 
01345   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01346   double           time_value
01347 ) { 
01348   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01349   try {
01350       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01351     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01352     if (!rec) {
01353         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01354       return 0 ;
01355     }
01356     // this form is called when we're doing fake blocking; so cannot
01357     // call get() directly and block;
01358     // instead, spawn a helper thread that will do the blocking call
01359     // and return
01360     sc_spawn_options op;
01361     char name[1024];
01362     sprintf(name, "get_bitstream_request_helper_%d", call_id);
01363     MARK_THREAD_INVISIBLE(op);
01364     sc_core::sc_spawn(sc_bind(&get_bitstream_request_helper,
01365                               rec,
01366                               call_id,
01367                               callback_adapter_id
01368                              ),
01369                       name, 
01370                       &op
01371                      );
01372     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01373     return 0;
01374   }
01375   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_2_INT
01376 
01377 
01378   return 0;
01379 }
01380 
01381 unsigned uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_requested(
01382     unsigned connector_id, 
01383     unsigned call_id , 
01384     uvm_ml_stream_t stream
01385 ) {
01386   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01387   try {
01388       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01389     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01390     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01391     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01392     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01393     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01394     void* p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
01395     uvm_ml_packed_obj* retval = call_id_rec_dict[p_call_id];
01396     unsigned size =  uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(*retval, stream);
01397 
01398     uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(retval);
01399     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01400     return size;
01401   }
01402   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_1
01403 }

01448 // so exception catching is more specialized

01451   unsigned* stream_size_ptr,
01452   uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01453   uvm_ml_time_unit * time_unit, 
01454   double           * time_value
01455 ) { 
01456     ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01457   int ret = 0;
01458   EXCEPTION_HANDLER_STORAGE();
01459   char msg[1024];
01460   sprintf(msg, "\nTLM function is peek");
01461   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01462   try {
01463       STORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01464     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01465     if (!rec) { 
01466         RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01467         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01468       return 0; 
01469     }
01470     ret = rec->peek_bitstream(stream_size_ptr, stream);
01471     RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01472     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01473     return ret;
01474   } 
01475   SC_KILL_CATCHER()
01476   catch( const sc_report& ex ) {
01477       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01478       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01479       UVM_ML_SC_PRINT_REPORT(ex);
01480     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01481     return ret;
01482   }
01483   catch( const ::std::exception& x )
01484   {
01485       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01486       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01487       UVM_ML_REPORT_COMPOSE_MESSAGE(x);
01488     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01489     return ret;
01490   }
01491   catch( const char* s )
01492   {
01493       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01494       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01495     cout << "\n" << s << "\n";
01496     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01497     return ret;
01498   }
01499   EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01500   return ret;
01501 }

01634 
01635 // transport_bitstream takes part in disable protocol as it is blocking,
01636 // so exception catching is more specialized
01637 
01638 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::transport(
01639     unsigned connector_id, 
01640     unsigned req_stream_size, 
01641     uvm_ml_stream_t req_stream,
01642     unsigned* rsp_stream_size, 
01643     uvm_ml_stream_t rsp_stream, 
01644   uvm_ml_time_unit * time_unit, 
01645   double           * time_value
01646 ) {
01647     ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01648   int ret = 0;
01649   EXCEPTION_HANDLER_STORAGE();
01650   char msg[1024];
01651   sprintf(msg, "\nTLM function is transport");
01652   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01653 
01654   try {
01655       STORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01656     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01657     if (!rec) { 
01658         RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01659         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01660       return 0; 
01661     }
01662     ret = rec->transport_bitstream(
01663       req_stream_size, 
01664       req_stream,
01665       rsp_stream_size, 
01666       rsp_stream
01667     );
01668     RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01669     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01670     return ret;
01671   } 
01672   SC_KILL_CATCHER()
01673   catch( const sc_report& ex ) {
01674       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01675       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01676       UVM_ML_SC_PRINT_REPORT(ex);
01677     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01678 
01679     return ret;
01680   }
01681   catch( const ::std::exception& x )
01682   {
01683       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01684       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01685       UVM_ML_REPORT_COMPOSE_MESSAGE(x);
01686     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01687 
01688     return ret;
01689   }
01690   catch( const char* s )
01691   {
01692       RESTORE_OLD_EXCEPTION_HANDLER();
01693       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01694     cout << "\n" << s << "\n";
01695     report_tlm1_error(rec);
01696     //sc_get_curr_simcontext()->set_error();
01697     return ret;
01698   }
01699   EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01700   return ret;
01701 }
01702 
01703 void transport_bitstream_request_helper(
01704   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec,
01705   unsigned call_id,
01706   unsigned callback_adapter_id,
01707   MLUPO* mlupo_req_stream 
01708 ) {
01709   try {
01710     MLUPO* rspval = uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool();
01711     uvm_ml_utils::allocate_mlupo(rspval);
01712     // call blocking transport()
01713     rec->transport_bitstream(
01714       mlupo_req_stream->size,
01715       mlupo_req_stream->val,
01716       &(rspval->size), 
01717       rspval->val
01718     );
01719     // when transport() returns, first hash return value with call id to be 
01720     // retrieved later thru transport_response_bitstream()
01721     void* p_call_id;
01722     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01723     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01724     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01725     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01726     p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
01727     call_id_rec_dict.insert(p_call_id, rspval);
01728     // callback into source adapter
01729     // to inform that call has ended
01730     uvm_ml_tlm_trans::notify_end_blocking(callback_adapter_id, call_id);
01731     //delete mlupo_req_stream;
01732     uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(mlupo_req_stream);
01733   }
01734   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_3
01735 }
01736 
01737 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::request_transport(
01738     unsigned connector_id, 
01739     unsigned call_id, 
01740     unsigned callback_adapter_id, 
01741     unsigned req_stream_size, 
01742     uvm_ml_stream_t req_stream,
01743     unsigned* rsp_stream_size, 
01744     uvm_ml_stream_t rsp_stream, 
01745   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01746   double           time_value
01747 )  {
01748   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01749   try {
01750       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01751     rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01752     if (!rec) {
01753         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01754       return 0 ;
01755     }
01756     // this form is called when we're doing fake blocking; so cannot
01757     // call transport() directly and block;
01758     // instead, spawn a helper thread that will do the blocking call
01759     // and return
01760     sc_spawn_options op;
01761     char name[1024];
01762     sprintf(name, "transport_bitstream_request_helper_%d", call_id);
01763     MARK_THREAD_INVISIBLE(op);
01764 
01765     // copy the req_stream into a mlupo. This is necessary because it is 
01766     // likely that in backplane, they use the same stream for 
01767     // multiple calls - so for back to back calls the arguments will get
01768     // overwritten until we make a copy here;
01769     // the helper will delete the mlupo we allocate here when it is done
01770   
01771     //MLUPO* mlupo_req_stream = new MLUPO;
01772     MLUPO* mlupo_req_stream = uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool();
01773     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(*mlupo_req_stream,req_stream_size,req_stream);
01774 
01775     sc_core::sc_spawn(sc_bind(&transport_bitstream_request_helper,
01776                               rec,
01777                               call_id,
01778                               callback_adapter_id,
01779                               mlupo_req_stream
01780                              ),
01781                       name, 
01782                       &op
01783                      );
01784     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01785   }
01786   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_2_INT
01787 
01788   return 0;
01789 }
01790 
01791 unsigned uvm_ml_tlm_rec::transport_response(
01792   unsigned            connector_id,
01793   unsigned            call_id,
01794   uvm_ml_stream_t rsp_stream 
01795 ) {
01796   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01797   try {
01798       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01799     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01800     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01801     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01802     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01803     void* p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
01804     uvm_ml_packed_obj* rspval = call_id_rec_dict[p_call_id];
01805     unsigned size =  uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(*rspval, rsp_stream);
01806     //delete rspval;
01807     uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(rspval);
01808     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01809     return size;
01810   }
01811   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_1
01812 }
01813 
01814 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::nb_transport(
01815     unsigned connector_id, 
01816     unsigned req_stream_size, 
01817     uvm_ml_stream_t req_stream,
01818     unsigned* rsp_stream_size, 
01819     uvm_ml_stream_t rsp_stream, 
01820   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01821   double           time_value
01822 ) {
01823     cerr << "Unimplemented: uvm_ml_tlm_rec::nb_transport_bitstream, "
01824          << "should not be here!!!!!" << endl;
01825   return 0;
01826 }
01827 
01828 void uvm_ml_tlm_rec::write(
01829   unsigned connector_id, 
01830   unsigned stream_size , 
01831   uvm_ml_stream_t stream, 
01832   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01833   double           time_value
01834 ) { 
01835   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01836   try {
01837     ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01838     if(uvm_ml_utils::is_tlm2_connector(connector_id) == false) {
01839       // uvm_object based TLM1 transaction
01840       rec = get_receiver_base(connector_id);
01841       assert (rec != NULL);
01842       rec->write_bitstream(stream_size,stream);
01843     } else {
01844         ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn = uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id);
01845         if (conn) { // tlm_generic_payload based TLM2 transaction
01846           ml_tlm2_analysis_export_connector_base * analysis_export_conn = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_analysis_export_connector_base * >(conn);
01847           if (analysis_export_conn == NULL) {
01848             EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01849             UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: Internal error: connector is not an analysis export connector","");
01850             return;
01851           }
01852           analysis_export_conn->write_bitstream(stream_size,stream);
01853         }
01854         else
01855           UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: cannot find a connector for the incoming analysis interface call write()","");
01856     }
01857     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01858   }
01859   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_2_VOID
01860 }
01861 
01862 void uvm_ml_tlm_rec::notify_end_blocking(
01863   unsigned call_id, 
01864   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit, 
01865   double           time_value
01866 ) {
01867   uvm_ml_tlm_receiver_base* rec = 0;
01868   try {
01869       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT3();
01870     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01871     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01872     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01873     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01874     void* p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
01875     sc_event* e = call_id_trans_dict[p_call_id];
01876     if (!e) {
01877         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT5();
01878         SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_UNKNOWN_CALL_ID_, 0);
01879     } else {
01880         e->notify(); // will cause calling SC thread to get scheduled
01881         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT4();
01882     }
01883   }
01884   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_RECEIVER_2_VOID
01885 }
01886 
01888 
01889 // TLM2
01890 
01891 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_b_transport(
01892     unsigned              connector_id, 
01893     unsigned *            stream_size,
01894     uvm_ml_stream_t * stream,
01895     uvm_ml_time_unit *    delay_unit,
01896     double *              delay_value,
01897     uvm_ml_time_unit      time_unit, 
01898     double                time_value
01899 ) {
01900   ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn = 0;
01901 
01902   try {
01903       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01904     conn = uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id);
01905     if (!conn) { 
01906       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01907       return 1; // TBD FIXME
01908     }
01909     //assert(conn->is_target);
01910 
01911     ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *target_conn; 
01912     if(!(conn->is_target) || ((target_conn = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *>(conn)) == NULL) ) {
01913       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01914       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: tlm2_b_transport connector is not target","");
01915       return 1;
01916     };
01917 
01918     
01919     // Create MLUPO from stream
01920     uvm_ml_packed_obj& vt = uvm_ml_utils::get_static_mlupo(); 
01921     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(vt,*stream_size,*stream);
01922     
01923     target_conn->b_transport(vt, (sc_time_unit *) delay_unit, delay_value, (sc_time_unit)time_unit, time_value);
01924     // Check that the incoming stream is big enough to store the 
01925     // transaction on the return path
01926     if (vt.size > *stream_size) 
01927       *stream = new unsigned[((vt.size-1)/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE)+1];
01928     // GL *stream = new unsigned[vt.size/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE];
01929     // it is the caller's responsibility to deallocate both streams
01930     *stream_size = uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(vt, *stream);    
01931 
01932 
01933     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
01934     return 0;
01935   }
01936   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_4
01937 }
01938 
01939 void uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_transport_request_helper(
01940   ml_tlm2_target_connector_base* conn,
01941   unsigned                       call_id,
01942   unsigned                       callback_adapter_id,
01943   MLUPO                        * mlupo_req_stream,
01944   sc_time_unit                   delay_unit, 
01945   double                         delay_value,
01946   sc_time_unit                   time_unit, 
01947   double                         time_value
01948 ) {
01949   try {
01950     conn->b_transport(
01951       *mlupo_req_stream,
01952       &delay_unit,
01953       &delay_value,
01954       time_unit,
01955       time_value
01956     );
01957     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
01958     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
01959     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
01960     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
01961     void* p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
01962     call_id_rec_dict.insert(p_call_id, mlupo_req_stream);
01963     call_id_delay_unit_dict[call_id] = delay_unit;
01964     call_id_delay_value_dict[call_id] = delay_value;
01965     // callback into source adapter to inform that call has ended
01966     uvm_ml_tlm_trans::notify_end_blocking(callback_adapter_id, call_id);
01967   }
01968   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_3
01969 }
01970 
01971 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_b_transport_request(
01972     unsigned            connector_id, 
01973     unsigned            call_id,
01974     unsigned            callback_adapter_id,
01975     unsigned            stream_size,
01976     uvm_ml_stream_t stream,
01977     uvm_ml_time_unit   delay_unit,
01978     double              delay_value,
01979     uvm_ml_time_unit    time_unit, 
01980     double              time_value
01981 ) {
01982   ml_tlm2_target_connector_base* conn = 0;
01983   try {
01984       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01985     conn = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *>(uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id));
01986     if (!conn) {
01987         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
01988         return 1; // TBD FIXME - 1 indicates disabled threads not an internal error
01989     }
01990 
01991     // this form is called when we're doing fake blocking; so cannot
01992     // call transport() directly and block;
01993     // instead, spawn a helper thread that will do the blocking call
01994     // and return
01995     sc_spawn_options op;
01996     char name[1024];
01997     sprintf(name, "tlm2_transport_request_helper_%d", call_id);
01998     MARK_THREAD_INVISIBLE(op);
01999 
02000     // copy the req_stream into a mlupo. This is necessary because it is 
02001     // likely that in backplane, they use the same stream for 
02002     // multiple calls - so for back to back calls the arguments will get
02003     // overwritten unless we make a copy here;
02004     // the helper will delete the mlupo we allocate here when it is done
02005   
02006     MLUPO* mlupo_req_stream = uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool();
02007     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(*mlupo_req_stream,stream_size,stream);
02008 
02009     sc_core::sc_spawn(sc_bind(&tlm2_transport_request_helper,
02010                               conn,
02011                               call_id,
02012                               callback_adapter_id,
02013                               mlupo_req_stream,
02014                               (sc_time_unit)delay_unit,
02015                               delay_value,
02016                               (sc_time_unit)time_unit,
02017                               time_value
02018                              ),
02019                       name, 
02020                       &op
02021                      );
02022     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
02023     return 0; // TBD FIXME - support disabling of the threads
02024   }
02025   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_4
02026 }
02027 
02028 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_b_transport_response(
02029     unsigned              connector_id, 
02030     unsigned              call_id,
02031     unsigned *            stream_size,
02032     uvm_ml_stream_t * stream
02033 ) {
02034   ml_tlm2_target_connector_base* conn = 0;
02035   try {
02036       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT2();
02037     conn = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *>(uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id));
02038     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
02039     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
02040     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
02041     // unsigend long matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
02042     void* p_call_id = (void*)(unsigned long)call_id;
02043     uvm_ml_packed_obj* rspval = call_id_rec_dict[p_call_id];
02044     *stream_size =  uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(*rspval, *stream);
02045     uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(rspval);
02046     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02047     return 0;
02048   }
02049   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_4
02050 }
02051 
02052 uvm_ml_tlm_sync_enum uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_nb_transport_fw(
02053     unsigned              connector_id,
02054     unsigned *            stream_size,
02055     uvm_ml_stream_t * stream,
02056     uvm_ml_tlm_phase *   phase,
02057     unsigned int          transaction_id,
02058     uvm_ml_time_unit *   delay_unit,
02059     double *              delay_value,
02060     uvm_ml_time_unit      time_unit, 
02061     double                time_value
02062 ) {
02063   ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn = 0;
02064   tlm_sync_enum ret;
02065 
02066   try {
02067       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02068     conn = uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id);
02069     if (!conn) { 
02070         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02071       return UVM_ML_TLM2_COMPLETED; // return error code
02072     }
02073     //assert(conn->is_target);
02074     ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *target_conn;
02075     if(!(conn->is_target) || (( target_conn = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_target_connector_base *>(conn) ) == NULL)) {
02076       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02077       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: tlm2_nb_transport_fw connector is not target","");
02078       return UVM_ML_TLM2_COMPLETED; // return error code
02079     };
02080 
02081     
02082     // Create MLUPO from stream
02083     uvm_ml_packed_obj& vt = uvm_ml_utils::get_static_mlupo(); 
02084     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(vt,*stream_size,*stream);
02085     
02086     ret = target_conn->nb_transport_fw(vt, (tlm_phase_enum *) phase, transaction_id, (sc_time_unit *) delay_unit, delay_value, (sc_time_unit)time_unit, time_value);
02087     // Check that the incoming stream is big enough to store the 
02088     // transaction on the return path
02089     if (vt.size > *stream_size) 
02090       *stream = new unsigned[((vt.size-1)/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE)+1];
02091     // GL *stream = new unsigned[vt.size/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE];
02092     // it is the caller's responsibility to deallocate both streams
02093     *stream_size = uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(vt, *stream);    
02094     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02095     return (uvm_ml_tlm_sync_enum) ret;
02096   }
02097   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_1
02098 }
02099 
02100 uvm_ml_tlm_sync_enum uvm_ml_tlm_rec::tlm2_nb_transport_bw(
02101     unsigned              connector_id,
02102     unsigned *            stream_size,
02103     uvm_ml_stream_t * stream,
02104     uvm_ml_tlm_phase *   phase,
02105     unsigned int          transaction_id,
02106     uvm_ml_time_unit *    delay_unit,
02107     double *              delay_value,
02108     uvm_ml_time_unit      time_unit, 
02109     double                time_value
02110 ) {
02111   ml_tlm2_connector_base* conn = 0;
02112   tlm_sync_enum ret;
02113 
02114   try {
02115       ENTER_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02116     conn = uvm_ml_utils::get_ml_tlm2_connector_base(connector_id);
02117     if (!conn) { 
02118         EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02119       return UVM_ML_TLM2_COMPLETED; // return error code
02120     }
02121     //assert(!conn->is_target);
02122     ml_tlm2_initiator_connector_base *initiator_conn;
02123     if((conn->is_target) || ((initiator_conn  = dynamic_cast<ml_tlm2_initiator_connector_base *>(conn)) ==NULL ) )  {
02124       EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02125       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: tlm2_nb_transport_bw connector is not target","");
02126       return UVM_ML_TLM2_COMPLETED; // return error code
02127     };
02128     // Create MLUPO from stream
02129     uvm_ml_packed_obj& vt = uvm_ml_utils::get_static_mlupo(); 
02130     uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(vt,*stream_size,*stream);
02131     
02132     ret = initiator_conn->nb_transport_bw(vt, (tlm_phase_enum *)phase, transaction_id, (sc_time_unit *)delay_unit, delay_value, (sc_time_unit)time_unit, time_value);
02133     // Check that the incoming stream is big enough to store the 
02134     // transaction on the return path
02135     if (vt.size > *stream_size) 
02136       *stream = new unsigned[((vt.size-1)/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE)+1];
02137     // GL *stream = new unsigned[vt.size/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE];
02138     // it is the caller's responsibility to deallocate both streams
02139     *stream_size = uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(vt, *stream);
02140     
02141     EXIT_CO_SIMULATION_CONTEXT();
02142     return (uvm_ml_tlm_sync_enum) ret;
02143   }
02144   CATCH_KERNEL_EXCEPTION_IN_CONNECTOR_1
02145 }

02200 
02201 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::create_child_junction_node(const char * component_type_name,
02202                                                const char * instance_name,
02203                                                const char * parent_full_name,
02204                                                int          parent_framework_id,
02205                                                int          parent_junction_node_id) {
02206 
02207     string componentTypeName = string(component_type_name);
02208     string instanceName = string(instance_name);
02209     string parentFullName = string(parent_full_name);
02210 
02211     return uvm_ml_utils::implement_create_child_junction_node(componentTypeName, instanceName, parentFullName, parent_framework_id, parent_junction_node_id);
02212 }
02213 
02214 static void * backplane_handle = NULL;
02215 
02216 static const char* const backplane_get_provided_tray = "bp_get_provided_tray";
02217 
02218 
02219 
02220 static bool backplane_loader_invoked = false;
02221 
02222 static void backplane_close() {
02223     if ( backplane_handle != NULL ) {
02224         // Close the backplane through the backplane loader
02225         // if that was used to open it
02226         // (Incisive only)
02227         if ( backplane_loader_invoked ) {
02228             backplane_loader_invoked = false;
02229             void * global_handle = dlopen(0, RTLD_LAZY);
02230             assert(global_handle != 0);
02231             void (*close_backplane_ptr)() = (void (*)())dlsym(global_handle, 
02232                                                           "cdns_close_uvm_ml_backplane");
02233             if ( close_backplane_ptr ) {
02234                 close_backplane_ptr();
02235             }
02236             
02237             dlclose(global_handle);
02238         } else {
02239             dlclose(backplane_handle);
02240         }
02241     }
02242 
02243 }
02244 
02245 static volatile struct unloading_handler {
02246     unloading_handler() {}
02247     ~unloading_handler() {
02248         backplane_close();
02249     }
02250 } v1;
02251 
02252 
02253 static void backplane_open()
02254 {
02255 
02256     void* (*load_uvm_ml_backplane_ptr)();
02257     void *global_handle;
02258     // The backplane library may be compiled in or preloaded
02259     // So, start with the 'global' namespace
02260     global_handle  = dlopen(0, RTLD_LAZY);
02261     
02262     if ( global_handle != 0) {
02263         if ( dlsym(global_handle, backplane_get_provided_tray) != 0) {
02264           backplane_handle = global_handle;
02265             return;
02266         }
02267     }
02268 
02269 
02270     load_uvm_ml_backplane_ptr = (void* (*)())dlsym(global_handle, "cdns_load_uvm_ml_backplane");
02271 
02272     dlclose(global_handle);
02273 
02274     if ( load_uvm_ml_backplane_ptr ) {
02275         if ( getenv("UVM_ML_DEBUG_MODE") ) {
02276             ::std::cerr << "UVM_ML_OA INFO: using the Incisive backplane loader" << ::std::endl;
02277         }
02278         backplane_loader_invoked = true;
02279         backplane_handle = load_uvm_ml_backplane_ptr();
02280     } else { 
02281         const char* const backplane_lib_name = "libuvm_ml_bp.so";
02282 
02283         
02284         char * lib_location = getenv("UVM_ML_OVERRIDE");
02285 
02286         if (lib_location == NULL) { 
02287             lib_location = getenv("UNILANG_OVERRIDE");
02288         }
02289         
02290         if (lib_location) {
02291             backplane_handle  = dlopen(((string)lib_location + "/"+backplane_lib_name).c_str(), RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL);
02292         } else {
02293             backplane_handle  = dlopen(backplane_lib_name, RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL);
02294         }
02295 
02296         if (backplane_handle == NULL) {
02297             string err_str = (char *) dlerror();
02298             
02299             // FIXME - use proper error messaging and proper per-simulator graceful shutdown mechanism here
02300             
02301             ::std::cout << "Failed to open the backplane library " << backplane_lib_name << " for the following reason: " << err_str << ::std::endl;
02302             // FIXME - replace with a macro
02303             #ifndef UVM_ML_PORTABLE
02304             exit(0);
02305             #else
02306             sc_stop();
02307             #endif
02308         }
02309     }
02310 
02311 }
02312 
02313 // Debug print tree
02314 uvm_component * find_child(string component_name, uvm_component * parent) {
02315     vector<uvm_component*> children = parent->get_children();
02316     for(unsigned i = 0; i < children.size(); i++) {
02317         if(!strcmp(component_name.c_str(), children[i]->name())) {
02318             return children[i];
02319         } else {
02320             uvm_component * child = find_child(component_name, children[i]);
02321             if(child != NULL) return child;
02322         }
02323     }
02324     return NULL;
02325 }
02326 
02327 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_num_children(const char * parent_name) {
02328     uvm_component * comp;
02329 
02330     for(unsigned i = 0; i < uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_tree_nodes.size(); i++) {
02331         comp = (uvm_component *)uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_tree_nodes[i];
02332         if(!strcmp(comp->name(), parent_name)) {
02333             return comp->get_num_children();
02334         } else {
02335             uvm_component * child = find_child(parent_name, comp);
02336             if(child != NULL) {
02337                 return child->get_num_children();
02338             }
02339         }
02340     }
02341     fprintf(stderr, "*** ERROR get_num_children: component not found %s\n", parent_name);
02342     return -1;
02343 };
02344 
02345 const char * uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_child_name(const char * parent_name, unsigned num) {
02346     uvm_component * comp;
02347     uvm_component * child;
02348 
02349     for(unsigned i = 0; i < uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_tree_nodes.size(); i++) {
02350         comp = (uvm_component *)uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_tree_nodes[i];
02351         if(!strcmp(comp->name(), parent_name)) {
02352             child = comp;
02353         } else {
02354             child = find_child(parent_name, comp);
02355         }
02356         if(child != NULL) {
02357             vector<uvm_component*> children = child->get_children();
02358             if(children.size() > num) {
02359                 return children[num]->name();
02360             } else {
02361                 fprintf(stderr, "*** ERROR get_child_name: index over the limit %d\n", num);
02362                 return "";
02363             }
02364         }
02365     }
02366     fprintf(stderr, "*** ERROR get_child_name: child not found\n");
02367     return "";
02368 }
02369 
02370 const char * uvm_ml_tlm_rec::get_component_type_name(const char * component_name) {
02371     return ""; // not implemented
02372 }
02373 
02374 int uvm_ml_tlm_rec::is_port(const char * component_name) {
02375     return 0; // not implemented
02376 }
02377 
02378 } // namespace uvm_ml
02380 
02381 EXTERN_DISABLE_SC_START;
02382 
02383 // return 0 for error
02384 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::initialize_adapter()
02385 {
02386     backplane_open();
02387 
02388     //assert(backplane_handle != NULL);
02389     if(backplane_handle == NULL) {
02390       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: backplane not initialized","");
02391       return 0; // return error code
02392     };
02393 
02394     bp_api_struct* (*bp_get_provided_tray_ptr)() = (bp_api_struct* (*)())dlsym(backplane_handle, backplane_get_provided_tray);
02395     bpProvidedAPI = (bp_get_provided_tray_ptr)();
02396     //assert(bpProvidedAPI != NULL);
02397     if(bpProvidedAPI == NULL) {
02398       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: backplane provided API not available","");
02399       return 0; // return error code
02400     };
02401     char *frmw_ids[3] = {(char*)"UVMSC", (char*)"SC",(char*)""};
02402     DISABLE_SC_START();
02403 
02404     uvm_ml_phase::Initialize(bpProvidedAPI);        // Initialize phasing
02405     uvm_ml_config_rsrc::Initialize(bpProvidedAPI);  // Initialize config/rsrc
02406 
02407     uvm_ml_event::initialize(bpProvidedAPI);
02408     uvm_ml_event_pool::initialize();        // register ml_event_pool
02409 
02410     uvm_ml_barrier::initialize(bpProvidedAPI);
02411     uvm_ml_barrier_pool::initialize();      // register ml_barrier_pool
02412 
02413     uvm_ml_sync::initialize(bpProvidedAPI);
02414 
02415     uvm_set_type_override(gen_type_name<uvm_event_pool>(), "uvm_ml_event_pool");
02416     uvm_set_type_override(gen_type_name<uvm_barrier_pool>(), "uvm_ml_barrier_pool");
02417 
02418     return BP(register_framework)((char*)"SystemC",frmw_ids, uvm_ml_sc_get_required_api());
02419 }

02424 }

02432 }

02437 namespace uvm_ml {
02438 
02439   void uvm_ml_connect(const string & port_name, const string & export_name, bool map_transactions) {
02440         if (IN_ELABORATION()) return;
02441         if (! ml_tlm2_check_cross_registration(port_name, export_name)) return;
02442         if (uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_construction_ended()) {
02443             unsigned result = uvm_ml_utils::do_connect(port_name, export_name);
02444             if(result == 0) return; // propagate error
02445             if (map_transactions == false) {
02446                 uvm_ml_utils::tlm2_turn_off_transaction_mapping(port_name, export_name);
02447             }
02448         } else {
02449             uvm_ml_utils::add_pending_uvm_ml_connect_call(port_name, export_name, map_transactions);
02450         }
02451     }
02452

02460   void uvm_ml_register_srv_providers(uvm_ml_srv_provider_struct * srv_providers)
02461   {

02463 
02464       bp_srv_providers = (bp_srv_provider_struct *) (srv_providers);
02465       BP(register_srv_providers)(framework_id, bp_srv_providers);
02466   }

02491 
02492   int uvm_ml_execute_command(const string & command, sc_severity error_severity = SC_ERROR)
02493   {
02494     if (IN_ELABORATION() == true) return (-1);
02495 
02496     int result = BP(execute_command)(framework_id, command.c_str(), NULL, m_time_unit, m_time_value);
02497     if (result != 1) {
02498       if (error_severity >= SC_FATAL)
02499         SC_REPORT_FATAL("UVM-ML SC", "UVM-ML SC adapter function uvm_ml_execute_command returned an error with fatal severity set");
02500       else if (error_severity == SC_ERROR)
02501         SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-ML SC", "UVM-ML SC adapter function uvm_ml_execute_command returned an error");
02502     }
02503     return result; 
02504   }

02592 
02593 int uvm_ml_utils::get_pack_block_size() {
02594     return UVM_ML_PACKING_BLOCK_SIZE_INT;
02595 }
02596 
02597 int uvm_ml_utils::get_max_bits() {
02598   static int pack_block_size = get_pack_block_size();
02599   int size = BP(get_pack_max_size)(framework_id);
02600   if (size == -1) { // uninitilaized in backplane
02601     char* c = 0;
02602     c = getenv("UVM_ML_BITSIZE");
02603     if (c) {
02604       size = atoi(c);
02605     }
02606     if (size < pack_block_size) {
02607       size = pack_block_size;
02608     }
02609   }
02610   return size;
02611 }
02612 
02613 int round_bits(int nbits) {
02614   static unsigned pack_block_size = uvm_ml_utils::get_pack_block_size();
02615   //int i = (nbits - 1)/UVM_PACKING_BLOCK_SIZE + 1;
02616   //int n = i*UVM_PACKING_BLOCK_SIZE;
02617   int i = (nbits - 1)/pack_block_size + 1;
02618   int n = i*pack_block_size;
02619   return n;
02620 }
02621 
02622 int uvm_ml_utils::get_max_words() {
02623   static int max_bits = uvm_ml_utils::get_max_bits();
02624   static int round_max_bits = round_bits(max_bits);
02625   static int max_words = 1 + (round_max_bits - 1)/32;
02626   return max_words;
02627 }
02628 
02629 void uvm_ml_utils::fill_mlupo(MLUPO& vt, unsigned size, void* stream) {
02630   int nwords;
02631   vt.size = size;
02632   uvm_ml_stream_t val = (uvm_ml_stream_t)stream;
02633   nwords = ((size-1)/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE)+1; // GL nwords = size/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE;
02634   int round_nbits = round_bits(nwords*32);
02635   int alloc_words = 1 + (round_nbits - 1)/32;
02636 
02637   // we could for simplicity also allocatethe max_words here, although
02638   // that is not necessary
02639  
02640   // we are always allocate mlupo in multiples of UVM_PACKING_BLOCK_SIZE;
02641   // not really necessary; optimize in future
02642 
02643   uvm_ml_packed_obj::allocate(&vt, alloc_words);
02644 
02645   memcpy(vt.val, val, nwords*sizeof(unsigned));
02646 }
02647 
02648 
02649 void uvm_ml_utils::allocate_mlupo(MLUPO* vt) {
02650 
02651   static int alloc_words = uvm_ml_utils::get_max_words();
02652    
02653 
02654   // we are always allocating mlupo in multiples of UVM_PACKING_BLOCK_SIZE;
02655   // not really necessary; optimize in future
02656 
02657   uvm_ml_packed_obj::allocate(vt, alloc_words);
02658 }
02659 
02660 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::copy_from_mlupo(const MLUPO& vt, void* stream) {
02661     int nwords;
02662     unsigned* ustream = (unsigned*)stream;
02663     nwords = ((vt.size-1)/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE)+1; // GL nwords = vt.size/UVM_ML_BLOCK_SIZE;
02664     memcpy(ustream, vt.val, nwords*sizeof(unsigned));
02665 
02666     return vt.size;
02667 }
02668 
02669 
02670 uvm_ml_packed_obj static_mlupo;
02671 
02672 uvm_ml_packed_obj& uvm_ml_utils::get_static_mlupo() {
02673   return static_mlupo;
02674 }
02675 
02676 std::queue<uvm_ml_packed_obj*> mlupo_free_q;
02677 
02678 uvm_ml_packed_obj* uvm_ml_utils::get_mlupo_from_pool() {
02679   uvm_ml_packed_obj* n = 0;
02680   int size = mlupo_free_q.size();
02681   if (size > 0) {
02682     n = mlupo_free_q.front();
02683     mlupo_free_q.pop();
02684     return n;
02685   }
02686   // allocate new mlupo
02687   //cout << "**************allocating new mlupo " << endl;
02688 #ifdef _NCSC_DEBUG
02689   dbginfo(U) << "**************allocating new mlupo " << endl;
02690 #endif
02691   n = new uvm_ml_packed_obj();
02692   return n;
02693 }
02694   
02695 void uvm_ml_utils::release_mlupo_to_pool(uvm_ml_packed_obj* n) {
02696   mlupo_free_q.push(n);
02697 }
02698 
02699 void uvm_ml_utils::register_static_top(const string & full_name) {
02700 
02701   if ((IN_ELABORATION() == false) && (uvm_ml_utils::quasi_static_elaboration_started() == false)) {
02702     string top_name;
02703 
02704     size_t posDelim = full_name.find_first_of(".");
02705     if (posDelim != string::npos)
02706       top_name = full_name.substr(0, posDelim);
02707     else
02708       top_name = full_name;
02709   
02710     if (std::find(static_top_names.begin(), static_top_names.end(), top_name) != static_top_names.end())
02711       return; // Already registered 
02712 
02713     if (BP(add_root_node)(framework_id,
02714                           get_next_top_id(),
02715                           top_name.c_str(),
02716                           top_name.c_str()) == (-1))
02717         SC_REPORT_ERROR(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_,"Duplicate top component instance name ");
02718 
02719     static_top_names.push_back(top_name);
02720   }
02721 }
02722 
02723 unsigned int uvm_ml_utils::add_quasi_static_tree_node(sc_module * pmod) { 
02724     quasi_static_tree_nodes.push_back (pmod); 
02725     return static_top_names.size() + quasi_static_tree_nodes.size() - 1; 
02726 };
02727 
02729 
02735 class uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info {
02736 public:
02737     uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info(const string & port_name, const string & export_name, bool map_transactions = true):  
02738         m_port_name(port_name), m_export_name(export_name), m_map_transactions(map_transactions)
02739     {
02740     }
02741     string m_port_name;
02742     string m_export_name;
02743     bool m_map_transactions;
02744 };
02745 
02746 typedef std::vector<uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info*> uvm_ml_tlm_connection_vec;
02747 
02748 static uvm_ml_tlm_connection_vec* pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls = 0;
02749 
02750 unsigned uvm_ml_utils::do_connect (const string & port_name, const string & export_name) {
02751     //assert (bpProvidedAPI != NULL);
02752     if(bpProvidedAPI == NULL) {
02753       char msg[1024];
02754       sprintf(msg, "\nPort is '%s'; Export is '%s' \n", port_name.c_str(), export_name.c_str());
02755       UVM_ML_SC_REPORT_ERROR("UVM-SC adapter: do_connect failed",msg);
02756       return 0; // propagate error 
02757     };
02758     return BP(connect)(framework_id,port_name.c_str(),export_name.c_str());
02759 }
02760 
02761 void uvm_ml_utils::add_pending_uvm_ml_connect_call(const string & port_name,
02762                                                    const string & export_name, 
02763                                                    bool map_transactions) {
02764   if (!pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls) {
02765     pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls = new uvm_ml_tlm_connection_vec;
02766   }
02767   uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info* info = 
02768       new uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info(port_name, export_name, map_transactions);
02769   pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls->push_back(info);
02770 }
02771 
02772 void uvm_ml_utils::tlm2_turn_off_transaction_mapping(const string & port_name, 
02773                                                      const string & export_name) {
02774     BP(turn_off_transaction_mapping)(framework_id, port_name.c_str());
02775     BP(turn_off_transaction_mapping)(framework_id, export_name.c_str());
02776 }
02777 
02778 int uvm_ml_utils::do_pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls() {
02779 
02780   int result = 1;
02781   if (pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls) {
02782 
02783       for (unsigned i = 0; i < pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls->size(); i++) {
02784           uvm_ml_tlm_connection_info* info = (*pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls)[i];
02785           result = uvm_ml_utils::do_connect(info->m_port_name, info->m_export_name);
02786           if (result == 0) {
02787               // user cannot process the connection result because it was postponed
02788               SC_REPORT_INFO("UVM-SC adapter: TLM connection failed","");
02789               return 0;
02790           }
02791           if (info->m_map_transactions == false) {
02792               tlm2_turn_off_transaction_mapping(info->m_port_name, info->m_export_name);
02793           }
02794       }
02795       pending_uvm_ml_connect_calls->clear();
02796   }
02797   return result;
02798 }
02799 
02800 int uvm_ml_debug::receive_command(const char *     command,
02801                                   bp_output_cb_t * output_cb,
02802                                   uvm_ml_time_unit time_unit,
02803                                   double           time_value) {
02804   string         command_s = command;
02805   stringstream   ss(command_s);
02806   string         token;
02807   vector<string> tokens;
02808 
02809   while (std::getline(ss, token, ' '))
02810       if (!token.empty())
02811           tokens.push_back(token);
02812 
02813   // Meantime the adapter supports only one command: "trace_register"
02814   if ((tokens[0] == "trace_register") || 
02815       (tokens[0] == "uvm_ml_trace_register") || 
02816       (tokens[0] == "trace_register_tlm")) {
02817       // The adapter does not check legality of syntax of the predefined command
02818       // The backplane is responsible for checking the syntax and printing the help for this command
02819 
02820       if (output_cb != NULL)
02821          SC_REPORT_WARNING(ML_UVM_RUN_TIME_ERROR_, "Currently command trace_register does not support re-direction of the output");    
02822 
02823       if (tokens[1] == "-on")
02824           uvm_ml_utils::set_trace_register (true);
02825       else if (tokens[1] == "-off")
02826           uvm_ml_utils::set_trace_register (false);
02827       else
02828         return 0;
02829       return 1; //success of setting trace_register
02830   }
02831   return -1; // other commands return UNRECOGNIZED_COMMAND (-1) 
02832 }
02833 
02834 // ///////////////////////
02835 
02836 void uvm_ml_tlm_trans::request_put(
02837   unsigned port_connector_id,
02838   MLUPO* arg 
02839 ) {
02840   unsigned call_id = fake_blocking_call_id++;
02841   unsigned done = 0;
02842   int disable = BP(request_put)(
02843     framework_id,
02844     port_connector_id,
02845     call_id,
02846     arg->size,
02847     arg->val,
02848     &done,
02849     &m_time_unit,
02850     &m_time_value
02851   );
02852   if (!done) {
02853     //SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_DONE_BIT_,"");
02854     void* p_call_id;
02855     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
02856     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
02857     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
02858     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
02859     p_call_id = (void *)(unsigned long)call_id;
02860     sc_event *e = new INVISIBLE_EVENT("uvm_fake_blocking");
02861     call_id_trans_dict.insert(p_call_id, e);
02862     sc_core::wait(*e);
02863     // we are here when the target adaptor has informed us via 
02864     // the backplane that the call has finished in it;
02865     // delete call_id and event ptrs
02866     delete e;
02867   }
02868   if (disable == 1) {
02869     // rule out the cases that 1) SC process initiated call (ECC) and child
02870     // SV is disabled; this is illegal at present
02871     // 2) e initiated call and somehow 1 is returned here
02872       uvm_ml::dpi_task_disabled();
02873   }
02874 }
02875 
02876 int uvm_ml_tlm_trans::nb_put(
02877   unsigned local_port_id, 
02878   MLUPO* val
02879 ) {
02880     return BP(nb_put)(
02881     framework_id,
02882     local_port_id,
02883     val->size,
02884     val->val,
02885     m_time_unit,
02886     m_time_value
02887   );
02888 }

02900 
02901 //
02902 
02903 void uvm_ml_tlm_trans::request_get(
02904   unsigned port_connector_id,
02905   MLUPO* arg
02906 ) {
02907   unsigned call_id = fake_blocking_call_id++;
02908   unsigned done = 0;
02909   int disable = BP(request_get)(
02910     framework_id,
02911     port_connector_id,
02912     call_id,
02913     &(arg->size),
02914     arg->val,
02915     &done,
02916     &m_time_unit,
02917     &m_time_value
02918   );
02919   if (!done) { // fake blocking
02920     //SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_DONE_BIT_,"");
02921     // new sc_event; hash <call_id , event>; wait on event;
02922     // later target will cause event to be triggered
02923     void* p_call_id;
02924     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
02925     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
02926     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
02927     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
02928     p_call_id = (void *)(unsigned long)call_id;
02929     sc_event* e = new INVISIBLE_EVENT("uvm_fake_blocking");
02930     call_id_trans_dict.insert(p_call_id, e);
02931     sc_core::wait(*e);
02932     // we are here when target adaptor has informed us via 
02933     // the backplane that the call has finished in it;
02934     // get the return value of get() from the backplane
02935     arg->size = BP(get_requested)(
02936       framework_id,
02937       port_connector_id,
02938       call_id,
02939       arg->val
02940     );
02941     // delete call_id and event ptrs
02942     delete e;
02943   }
02944   if (disable == 1) {
02945       uvm_ml::dpi_task_disabled();
02946   }
02947 }
02948 
02949 int uvm_ml_tlm_trans::nb_get(unsigned local_port_id, MLUPO* val) {
02950     return BP(nb_get)(
02951     framework_id, 
02952     local_port_id, 
02953     &(val->size),
02954     val->val,
02955     m_time_unit,
02956     m_time_value
02957   );
02958 }

02985     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
02986     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;

03025 int uvm_ml_tlm_trans::request_transport(
03026   unsigned port_connector_id,
03027   MLUPO* req,
03028   MLUPO* rsp
03029 ) {
03030   unsigned call_id = fake_blocking_call_id++;
03031   unsigned done = 0;
03032   int disable = BP(request_transport)(
03033     framework_id,
03034     port_connector_id,
03035     call_id,
03036     req->size,
03037     req->val,
03038     &(rsp->size),
03039     rsp->val,
03040     &done,
03041     &m_time_unit,
03042     &m_time_value
03043   );
03044   if (!done) {
03045     //SC_REPORT_ERROR(UVM_DONE_BIT_,"");
03046     // new sc_event; hash <call_id , event>; wait on event;
03047     // later target will cause event to be triggered
03048     void* p_call_id;
03049     // need to do the cast to unsigned long below before casting to pointer
03050     // because on 64 bit m/cs pointers are 64 bits, whereas unsigned is 32
03051     // bits; so casting from unsigned to pointer generates compiler warning;
03052     // unsigend long  matches the size of pointers on 32 bit and 64 bit m/cs
03053     p_call_id = (void *)(unsigned long)call_id;
03054 
03055     sc_event* e = new INVISIBLE_EVENT("uvm_fake_blocking");
03056 
03057     call_id_trans_dict.insert(p_call_id, e);
03058     sc_core::wait(*e);
03059     // we are here when target adaptor has informed us via
03060     // the backplane that the call has finished in it;
03061     // get the return value of get() from the backplane
03062     rsp->size = BP(transport_response)(
03063       framework_id,
03064       port_connector_id,
03065       call_id,
03066       rsp->val
03067     );
03068     // delete call_id and event ptrs
03069     delete e;
03070   }
03071   if (disable == 1) {
03072       uvm_ml::dpi_task_disabled();
03073   }
03074 
03075   return 0;
03076 }
